summary.p: In response to Bullinger's question about news, he and Vadian can only confirm what they have previously reported about the troop assembly [in the Etschtal]; he asks to discuss it with [Johannes] Haab. Greetings.

div.p: May God's grace preserve us. Amen.

My lord, your request to my dear lord Mayor of WÃ¤denswil, and then to me, whether we have any news to send to you by messenger, I have personally been with my lord and asked. He, as well as I, have nothing special. Although the pastor at this time, when I was with him, wrote about the matter of the troop assembly, which all aligns and almost completely agrees with the report I wrote to you the other day from him and me, by a citizen of St. Gallen, who received the message on the way, etc., all sorts of things that I wrote to you about. You should (as we know) earnestly discuss with Master Haab.
Yours, greeting my wife and your whole household.
Done in St. Gallen, on Tuesday, the first day of the month of June in the year 1535.
Your obliged, willing Hans Vogler, etc.
To my especially beloved lord and friend, Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich.
